This file contains a packed representation of the entire repository's contents.

// src/App.tsx
import React from 'react';
import { Dashboard } from './views/Dashboard';

const App: React.FC = () => {
  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-gray-50 text-slate-900">
      {/* Justificación: Usamos un componente 'Dashboard' para mantener App.tsx limpio. 
          Aquí podrías añadir un Navbar o un Footer global en el futuro.
      */}
      <nav className="bg-white border-b border-gray-200 py-4 px-8">
        <div className="max-w-7xl mx-auto flex justify-between items-center">
          <span className="text-xl font-bold text-indigo-600">
            Nexus <span className="text-gray-400 font-light">E-commerce</span>
          </span>
          <div className="flex gap-4 text-sm font-medium text-gray-600">
            <span>Status: <span className="text-green-500">Connected</span></span>
          </div>
        </div>
      </nav>

      <main className="max-w-7xl mx-auto py-10 px-4">
        <Dashboard />
      </main>
    </div>
  );
};

export default App;
```

import App from './App.tsx';
import '../index.css'; // <--- VITAL: Debe estar aquí para que Tailwind afecte a toda la app

ReactDOM.createRoot(document.getElementById('root') as HTMLElement).render(
  <React.StrictMode>
    <App />
  </React.StrictMode>
);
```

## src/services/api.ts

```typescript
// src/services/api.ts
import axios from 'axios';
import { BaseResponse, Product, Inventory } from '../types/api.responses';

const api = axios.create({
  baseURL: import.meta.env.VITE_API_URL || 'http://localhost:3000',
});

export const productSvc = {
  getAll: () => api.get<BaseResponse<Product[]>>('/product'),
  create: (data: Partial<Product>) => api.post<BaseResponse<Product>>('/product', data),
};

export const inventorySvc = {
  getAll: () => api.get<BaseResponse<Inventory[]>>('/inventory'),
};
```

## src/types/api.responses.ts

```typescript
// Estas interfaces deben coincidir con tus Entidades/DTOs del Repomix
export interface Product {
  id: number;
  name: string;
  description: string;
  price: number;
  isActive: boolean;
}

export interface Inventory {
  id: number;
  productId: number;
  quantity: number;
}

// El wrapper de respuesta que vi en tu GlobalFilter del backend
export interface ApiResponse<T> {
  isSuccess: boolean;
  message: string;
  data: T;
  errors?: string[];
}
```

## src/api/api.ts

```typescript
// src/services/api.ts
import axios from 'axios';
import { ApiResponse, Product, Inventory } from '../types/api.responses';

const api = axios.create({
  baseURL: import.meta.env.VITE_API_URL || 'http://localhost:3000/api',
});

export const productSvc = {
  // 1. Intenta con plurales si el 404 persiste, es el estándar de Nest (products)
  getAll: () => api.get<ApiResponse<Product[]>>('/products'), 
  create: (data: Partial<Product>) => api.post<ApiResponse<Product>>('/products', data),
};

export const inventorySvc = {
  // 2. Basado en tu log, la ruta de inventario parece estar bajo /inventory
  // Si el 404 persiste, prueba con '/inventories' o '/inventory'
  getAll: () => api.get<ApiResponse<Inventory[]>>('/inventory'),
};

export default api;
```

## src/services/api.ts

```typescript
// src/services/api.ts
import axios from 'axios';
import { ApiResponse, Product, Inventory } from '../types/api.responses';

const api = axios.create({
  // Importante: Verifica si tu backend usa el prefijo /api
  baseURL: import.meta.env.VITE_API_URL || 'http://localhost:3000/api',
});

export const productSvc = {
  // Si te da 404, prueba cambiando 'product' por 'products' (plural)
  getAll: () => api.get<ApiResponse<Product[]>>('/product'),
  
  create: (data: Partial<Product>) => 
    api.post<ApiResponse<Product>>('/product', data),
};

export const inventorySvc = {
  // Si te da 404, prueba cambiando 'inventory' por 'inventories'
  getAll: () => api.get<ApiResponse<Inventory[]>>('/inventory'),
};
api.interceptors.request.use((config) => {
  const token = localStorage.getItem('token');
  if (token) {
    config.headers.Authorization = `Bearer ${token}`;
  }
  return config;
});
export default api;
```

## src/types/api.responses.ts

```typescript
// Estas interfaces deben coincidir con tus Entidades/DTOs del Repomix
export interface Product {
  id: number;
  name: string;
  description: string;
  price: number;
  isActive: boolean;
}

export interface Inventory {
  id: number;
  productId: number;
  quantity: number;
}

// El wrapper de respuesta que vi en tu GlobalFilter del backend
export interface ApiResponse<T> {
  isSuccess: boolean;
  message: string;
  data: T;
  errors?: string[];
}
```

## src/views/Dashboard.tsx

```text
import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react';
import { productSvc, inventorySvc } from '../services/api';
import { Product, Inventory } from '../types/api.responses';

export const Dashboard: React.FC = () => {
  const [products, setProducts] = useState<Product[]>([]);
  const [inventory, setInventory] = useState<Inventory[]>([]);

const fetchData = async () => {
  try {
    const prodRes = await productSvc.getAll();
    const invRes = await inventorySvc.getAll();
    
    // Accedemos a .data porque Axios envuelve la respuesta, 
    // y luego a .data de nuevo porque tu backend usa un wrapper ApiResponse
    setProducts(prodRes.data.data || []);
    setInventory(invRes.data.data || []);
  } catch (error) {
    console.error("Error fetching data - Posible ruta incorrecta:", error);
    // Seteamos arrays vacíos para evitar que el .map falle
    setProducts([]);
    setInventory([]);
  }
};
  useEffect(() => {
    fetchData();
    // Opcional: Polling cada 5 segundos para ver eventos de inventario
    const interval = setInterval(fetchData, 5000);
    return () => clearInterval(interval);
  }, []);

  return (
    <div className="grid grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 gap-8">
      <div className="bg-white p-6 rounded-xl shadow-md border border-gray-100">
        <h2 className="text-xl font-bold mb-4 text-indigo-700">Catálogo de Productos</h2>
        <div className="space-y-2">
          {products.map(p => (
            <div key={p.id} className="p-3 bg-gray-50 rounded border">
              <p className="font-semibold">{p.name}</p>
              <p className="text-sm text-gray-500">${p.price}</p>
            </div>
          ))}
        </div>
      </div>

      <div className="bg-white p-6 rounded-xl shadow-md border-t-4 border-indigo-500">
        <h2 className="text-xl font-bold mb-4 text-indigo-700">Stock en Inventario (Event-Driven)</h2>
        <table className="w-full text-left text-sm">
          <thead>
            <tr className="border-b">
              <th className="py-2">Prod ID</th>
              <th className="py-2">Cantidad</th>
            </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody>
            {inventory.map(i => (
              <tr key={i.id} className="border-b">
                <td className="py-2 font-mono">#{i.productId}</td>
                <td className="py-2 font-bold text-green-600">{i.quantity} unidades</td>
              </tr>
            ))}
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};
```

{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "ESNext",
    "useDefineForClassFields": true,
    "lib": ["DOM", "DOM.Iterable", "ESNext"],
    "allowJs": false,
    "skipLibCheck": true,
    "esModuleInterop": true,
    "allowSyntheticDefaultImports": true,
    "strict": true,
    "forceConsistentCasingInFileNames": true,
    "module": "ESNext",
    "moduleResolution": "bundler",
    "resolveJsonModule": true,
    "isolatedModules": true,
    "noEmit": true,
    "jsx": "react-jsx",
    "types": ["vite/client"],
    /* Agrega estas dos líneas para solucionar el WARNING */
    "baseUrl": ".", 
    "paths": {
      "@/*": ["./src/*"]
    }
  },
  "include": ["src/**/*.ts", "src/**/*.tsx", "src/**/*.d.ts"],
  "exclude": ["node_modules"]
}

import react from '@vitejs/plugin-react'

export default defineConfig({
  plugins: [react()],
  server: {
    port: 5173,
    proxy: {
      '/api': 'http://localhost:3000' // Evita problemas de CORS en desarrollo
    }
  }
})
